TestCases.TestDescription: Verify successful mapping of patient identifier from PID.3 to Patient.identifier with a valid patient ID.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource with identifier populated with the value from PID.3 and system set to http://hospital.org/patient-ids.
TestSteps: Provide an ADT message with a valid patient ID in PID.3.
Transform the ADT message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.identifier.value in the FHIR resource matches the value in PID.3.
Validate that the Patient.identifier.system in the FHIR resource is http://hospital.org/patient-ids.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: Test passes if Patient.identifier.value is correctly mapped from PID.3 and Patient.identifier.system is correctly set to http://hospital.org/patient-ids.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify handling of missing patient identifier in PID.3. Patient.identifier should not be populated.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource with identifier element not populated.
TestSteps: Provide an ADT message with an empty PID.3 field.
Transform the ADT message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.identifier element is not present in the FHIR resource.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: Test passes if the Patient.identifier element is not present in the FHIR resource.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify handling of invalid characters in PID.3. Patient.identifier should contain the invalid data or be handled as configured (e.g., error logged).
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource with identifier containing invalid characters as is, or an error is logged, depending on the system's error handling configuration.
TestSteps: Provide an ADT message with PID.3 containing invalid characters (e.g., special symbols).
Transform the ADT message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate the Patient.identifier.value for the presence of invalid characters, or verify that the system's error log indicates an error.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: Test passes if the Patient.identifier.value contains the invalid characters as is, or if an error is logged.

TestCases.TestDescription: Regression test to ensure patient identifier mapping from PID.3 to Patient.identifier continues to function correctly after system updates.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource with identifier populated correctly from PID.3, system http://hospital.org/patient-ids.
TestSteps: Provide an ADT message with a valid patient ID in PID.3.
Transform the ADT message to a FHIR Patient resource using the updated system.
Validate that the Patient.identifier.value in the FHIR resource matches the value in PID.3, and system is http://hospital.org/patient-ids.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: Test passes if Patient.identifier.value is correctly mapped from PID.3 and system is http://hospital.org/patient-ids.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify successful mapping of patient name components from PID.5 to Patient.name.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource with name populated with family, given, and prefix from PID.5.1, PID.5.2, and PID.5.5 respectively.
TestSteps: Provide an ADT message with valid name components in PID.5.1, PID.5.2, and PID.5.5.
Transform the ADT message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.name.family matches PID.5.1, Patient.name.given matches PID.5.2, and Patient.name.prefix matches PID.5.5.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: Test passes if Patient.name.family, Patient.name.given, and Patient.name.prefix are correctly mapped from PID.5.1, PID.5.2, and PID.5.5 respectively.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify handling of missing name components in PID.5. Patient.name should be populated with available components.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource with name populated with only the available name components from PID.5.
TestSteps: Provide an ADT message with only PID.5.1 populated and PID.5.2 and PID.5.5 empty.
Transform the ADT message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.name.family is populated from PID.5.1 and Patient.name.given and Patient.name.prefix are not present.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: Test passes if Patient.name is populated only with the available name components from PID.5.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify handling of multiple given names in PID.5.2. All given names should be present in Patient.name.given.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource with Patient.name.given containing all given names from PID.5.2.
TestSteps: Provide an ADT message with multiple given names in PID.5.2 (e.g., 'John David').
Transform the ADT message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that Patient.name.given contains both 'John' and 'David'.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: Test passes if Patient.name.given contains all given names from PID.5.2.

TestCases.TestDescription: Regression test to ensure patient name mapping from PID.5 to Patient.name continues to function correctly after system updates.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource with name populated correctly from PID.5.
TestSteps: Provide an ADT message with valid name components in PID.5.
Transform the ADT message to a FHIR Patient resource using the updated system.
Validate that Patient.name.family, Patient.name.given, and Patient.name.prefix are correctly mapped from PID.5.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: Test passes if Patient.name is correctly mapped from PID.5.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify successful mapping of patient birth date from PID.7 to Patient.birthDate with a valid date format.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource with birthDate populated from PID.7 in YYYY-MM-DD format.
TestSteps: Provide an ADT message with a valid birth date in PID.7 in YYYYMMDD format.
Transform the ADT message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.birthDate matches the converted date from PID.7 in YYYY-MM-DD format.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: Test passes if Patient.birthDate is correctly mapped and formatted from PID.7.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify handling of missing birth date in PID.7. Patient.birthDate should not be populated.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource with birthDate not populated.
TestSteps: Provide an ADT message with an empty PID.7 field.
Transform the ADT message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.birthDate element is not present in the FHIR resource.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: Test passes if the Patient.birthDate element is not present in the FHIR resource.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify handling of invalid date format in PID.7. Patient.birthDate should not be populated or an error should be logged.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource with birthDate not populated, or an error is logged.
TestSteps: Provide an ADT message with an invalid date format in PID.7 (e.g., YYYY/MM/DD).
Transform the ADT message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.birthDate is not populated or an error is logged.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: Test passes if Patient.birthDate is not populated or an error is logged.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify handling of edge case date 19000101. Patient.birthDate should be populated
TestSteps: Provide an ADT message with PID.7 set to 19000101.
Transform the ADT message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that Patient.birthDate is 1900-01-01.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: Test passes if Patient.birthDate is correctly set to 1900-01-01

TestCases.TestDescription: Regression test to ensure patient birth date mapping from PID.7 to Patient.birthDate continues to function correctly after system updates.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource with birthDate populated correctly from PID.7.
TestSteps: Provide an ADT message with a valid birth date in PID.7.
Transform the ADT message to a FHIR Patient resource using the updated system.
Validate that Patient.birthDate is correctly mapped and formatted from PID.7.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: Test passes if Patient.birthDate is correctly mapped from PID.7.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify successful mapping of patient gender from PID.8 to Patient.gender using HL7 Table 0001.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource with gender populated based on the HL7 Table 0001 mapping (M to male, F to female, U to unknown).
TestSteps: Provide an ADT message with PID.8 set to 'M'.
Transform the ADT message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.gender is set to 'male'.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: Test passes if Patient.gender is correctly mapped based on HL7 Table 0001.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify successful mapping of patient gender from PID.8 to Patient.gender using HL7 Table 0001.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource with gender populated based on the HL7 Table 0001 mapping (M to male, F to female, U to unknown).
TestSteps: Provide an ADT message with PID.8 set to 'F'.
Transform the ADT message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.gender is set to 'female'.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: Test passes if Patient.gender is correctly mapped based on HL7 Table 0001.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify successful mapping of patient gender from PID.8 to Patient.gender using HL7 Table 0001.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource with gender populated based on the HL7 Table 0001 mapping (M to male, F to female, U to unknown).
TestSteps: Provide an ADT message with PID.8 set to 'U'.
Transform the ADT message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.gender is set to 'unknown'.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: Test passes if Patient.gender is correctly mapped based on HL7 Table 0001.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify handling of missing gender in PID.8. Patient.gender should not be populated.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource with gender not populated.
TestSteps: Provide an ADT message with an empty PID.8 field.
Transform the ADT message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.gender element is not present in the FHIR resource.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: Test passes if the Patient.gender element is not present in the FHIR resource.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify handling of invalid gender code in PID.8. Patient.gender should not be populated or an error should be logged.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource with gender not populated, or an error is logged.
TestSteps: Provide an ADT message with an invalid gender code in PID.8 (e.g., 'X').
Transform the ADT message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.gender is not populated or an error is logged.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: Test passes if Patient.gender is not populated or an error is logged.

TestCases.TestDescription: Regression test to ensure patient gender mapping from PID.8 to Patient.gender continues to function correctly after system updates.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource with gender populated correctly from PID.8 based on HL7 Table 0001.
TestSteps: Provide an ADT message with a valid gender code in PID.8.
Transform the ADT message to a FHIR Patient resource using the updated system.
Validate that Patient.gender is correctly mapped based on HL7 Table 0001.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: Test passes if Patient.gender is correctly mapped from PID.8.
